title: Software Development
summary: Overview of software development methodologies and practices
description: Software development encompasses various methodologies, tools, and practices used to create applications and systems. This mindmap explores the key aspects of modern software development.

children.title: Frontend Development
children.summary: Client-side development focusing on user interfaces
children.description: Frontend development involves creating the visual and interactive parts of web applications that users see and interact with directly in their browsers.

children.title: React
children.summary: Popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces
children.description: React is a declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It lets you compose complex UIs from small and isolated pieces of code called 'components'.

children.title: Components
children.summary: Reusable building blocks of React applications
children.description: Components are the fundamental building blocks of React applications. They allow you to split the UI into independent, reusable pieces.

children.title: Hooks
children.summary: Functions that let you use state and lifecycle features
children.description: Hooks are functions that let you 'hook into' React state and lifecycle features from function components. They don't work inside classes.

children.title: Next.js
children.summary: React framework for production
children.description: Next.js is a React framework that enables functionality such as server-side rendering and generating static websites for React based web applications.

children.title: Material-UI
children.summary: React components implementing Google's Material Design
children.description: Material-UI is a popular React UI framework that implements Google's Material Design. It provides pre-built components that are ready for use in production.

children.title: Backend Development
children.summary: Server-side development handling business logic and data
children.description: Backend development focuses on server-side logic, databases, APIs, and the architecture that powers the application behind the scenes.

children.title: Node.js
children.summary: JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine
children.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. It allows developers to run JavaScript on the server-side.

children.title: Databases
children.summary: Systems for storing and managing data
children.description: Databases are organized collections of data that can be easily accessed, managed, and updated. They come in various types including relational and NoSQL.

children.title: PostgreSQL
children.summary: Advanced open-source relational database
children.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development.

children.title: MongoDB
children.summary: NoSQL document database
children.description: MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program. It uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas.

children.title: APIs
children.summary: Interfaces for communication between systems
children.description: APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) define the methods and data formats that applications can use to communicate with each other.

children.title: REST APIs
children.summary: Architectural style for designing networked applications
children.description: REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style for designing networked applications. It relies on a stateless, client-server protocol.

children.title: GraphQL
children.summary: Query language for APIs
children.description: GraphQL is a query language for APIs and a runtime for fulfilling those queries with your existing data. It provides a complete and understandable description of the data in your API.

children.title: DevOps
children.summary: Practices combining software development and IT operations
children.description: DevOps is a set of practices that combines software development (Dev) and IT operations (Ops). It aims to shorten the systems development life cycle and provide continuous delivery.

children.title: CI/CD
children.summary: Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
children.description: CI/CD is a method to frequently deliver apps to customers by introducing automation into the stages of app development. CI focuses on integrating changes, while CD focuses on delivering those changes.

children.title: Docker
children.summary: Platform for developing, shipping, and running applications
children.description: Docker is a platform designed to help developers build, share, and run modern applications. It uses containerization technology to package software into standardized units.

children.title: Kubernetes
children.summary: Container orchestration platform
children.description: Kubernetes is an open-source container orchestration platform designed to automate deploying, scaling, and operating application containers.

children.title: Testing
children.summary: Quality assurance practices in software development
children.description: Testing is a crucial part of software development that ensures code quality, functionality, and reliability. Various testing types help catch bugs and ensure software meets requirements.

children.title: Unit Testing
children.summary: Testing individual units or components
children.description: Unit testing involves testing individual units or components of software to ensure they work as expected. It helps catch bugs early in development.

children.title: Integration Testing
children.summary: Testing interactions between different parts of the system
children.description: Integration testing verifies that different modules or services used by your application work well together. It tests the interfaces between components.

children.title: End-to-End Testing
children.summary: Testing complete user workflows
children.description: End-to-end testing replicates real user scenarios from start to finish. It tests the entire application flow to ensure everything works together.
